message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about cooking methods. When a person lacks a grill or fire to cook a burger, they can heat the burger meat on a vehicle engine. This is because the engine produces heat when it is running, and placing the burger meat on a part of the engine can cook the meat. Option (A) is incorrect because a tree branch is not a source of heat. Option (B) and (C) are also incorrect because puddles and fish ponds do not provide enough heat to cook meat.
